p: Our in vitro studies involved primary gingival and dermal keratinocytes and fibroblasts as well as immortalized skin cell lines; studies indicate that primary cell cultures may provide more useful clinical data than immortalized ones due to their natural ploidy and similar biological parameters with in vivo cells [ 87]. Immortalized cells exhibit genotype and/or phenotype alterations that may result in different reactions to external stimuli; therefore, the use of primary cells is recommended in order to better mimic in vivo testing [ 88]. Also, primary human oral mucosal cells are superior to animal-related cell lines in terms of toxicity screening [ 87].
